paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the BRCA2 gene variant N372H, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: 100 patients with invasive breast cancer from the Republic of Macedonia

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Recent meta-analysis suggests that the BRCA2 N372H allele may be a low-penetrant risk factor for developing breast cancer.

functional_data.summary: The N372H variant is associated with slightly increased risk in patients with a family member with breast cancer.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with increased risk in patients with a family member with breast cancer.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was mentioned in the context of its association with breast cancer risk.
key_quotes: We observed that N372H is associated with slightly increased risk in patients with a family member with breast cancer [p = 0.0081; OR (95%CI) =2.37 (1.24–4.56)].

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was clear and well-defined in the text.
